SEARCH
Package cpsc2150.extendedCheckers.models

Interface ICheckerBoard

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbsCheckerBoard, CheckerBoard, CheckerBoardMem
public interface ICheckerBoard
The generic interface for our 2-dimensional checkerboard grid of characters. Indexing starts at 0

    Field

    static final char

  • Method Details

    • getViableDirections

      HashMap<Character,ArrayList<DirectionEnum>> getViableDirections()
      Standard getter for viableDirections of a checkerBoard
      Returns:
      the viableDirections of a checkerBoard, as a hashmap of characters and an arrayList of directionEnums

    • addViableDirections

      default void addViableDirections(char player, DirectionEnum dir)
      Function that maps players to the proper direction they can move in, modeled by DirectionEnum
      Parameters:
      player - represents a player piece, either standard or king, to be mapped to the possible directions
      dir - all possible directions that player could be mapped to

    • getPieceCounts

      HashMap<Character,Integer> getPieceCounts()
      Function that returns the hashmap that maps the pieces remaining per player (pieceCount)
      Returns:
      pieceCount, a dictionary mapping a player (char) and their pieces remaining (int) in the form of a HashMap

    • whatsAtPos

      char whatsAtPos(BoardPosition pos)
      Function that accesses the board and returns what is at a position.
      Parameters:
      pos - position to be modified in the array, BoardPosition object type
      Returns:
      value of the char at the index provided as a parameter

    • getRowNum

      int getRowNum()
      Function that gets the number of rows a checkerBoard is made of
      Returns:
      the number of rows the board is made of as an int

    • getColNum

      int getColNum()
      Function that gets the number of columns a checkerBoard is made of
      Returns:
      the number of columns a board is made of as an int

    • placePiece

      void placePiece(BoardPosition pos, char player)
      Function that modifies the board array to change a given position character
      Parameters:
      pos - position to be modified in the array, BoardPosition object type
      player - the char value of the player for the value of the piece to be added

    • checkPlayerWin

      default boolean checkPlayerWin(Character player)
      Function that states true or false if a player has won the game of checkers, happening when a only one player has remaining pieces on the board.
      Parameters:
      player - the char value of the player for the win to be checked
      Returns:
      True of false for if the given player has won as a boolean

    • crownPiece

      default void crownPiece(BoardPosition posOfPlayer)
      Function that modifies the character to uppercase version if piece reaches a position on the board
      Parameters:
      posOfPlayer - is a given board position that's piece is to be modified

    • movePiece

      default BoardPosition movePiece(BoardPosition startingPos, DirectionEnum dir)
      This function moves a piece on the board by using the startingPos and then using the DirectionEum to specify which direction to move to.
      Parameters:
      startingPos - position of piece to be modified and moved
      dir - direction to be moved with the enum
      Returns:
      returns BoardPosition value of the destination of the piece moved

    • jumpPiece

      default BoardPosition jumpPiece(BoardPosition startingPos, DirectionEnum dir)
      Function that moves a piece on the board two positions in the direction passed,thus jumping a piece. The function then removes the jumped piece.
      Parameters:
      startingPos - position of piece to be modified and moved
      dir - direction to be moved with the enum
      Returns:
      returns BoardPosition value of the destination of the piece moved

    • playerLostPieces

      default void playerLostPieces(int numPieces, char player, HashMap<Character,Integer> pieceCounts)
      Function subtracts numPieces amount of tokens from the pieceCounts HashMap.
      Parameters:
      numPieces - the int quantity of pieces to be removed
      player - the char value of the player whose piece count will be modified
      pieceCounts - passing the dictionary hashmap that tracks the player and corresponding piece count

    • scanSurroundingPositions

      default HashMap<DirectionEnum,Character> scanSurroundingPositions(BoardPosition startingPos)
      Function that scans all positions surrounding startingPos parameter
      Parameters:
      startingPos - individual BoardPosition representing the starting point of a potential movement
      Returns:
      returns a HashMap where each direction surrounding the specified startingPos is mapped to a character representing the state of the tile it points to

    • getDirection

      static BoardPosition getDirection(DirectionEnum dir)
      Function that creates a new BoardPosition based on a movement in the direction of dir parameter. It adds or subtracts values from the row and column position to indicate the change in position.
      Parameters:
      dir - direction for movement of piece
      Returns:
      a new BoardPosition that can be added to any piece so that it moves one position in the direction of dir
